0: ABBOTTABAD, Pakistan — The Pakistani doctor who helped the CIA track down Osama bin Laden through a fake vaccination program also assisted in the final confirmation of the terror kingpin’s hideout, intelligence sources said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Dr. Shakeel Afridi disappeared after bin Laden was killed in a US raid one year ago in the walled compound in the garrison town of Abbottabad. Afridi is being held in the custody of Pakistan’s Inter Services Intelligence agency. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The father-of-three angered Pakistan’s military authorities by helping the CIA organize a fake vaccination program to extract DNA from inside the bin Laden compound. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The program failed, but Afridi provided another vital clue, Pakistani intelligence officials told The (London) Times. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR PHOTOS: OSAMA BIN LADEN KILLED NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Afridi obtained a telephone number for, and spoke to, the compound’s putative owner, Abu Ahmed al Kuwaiti, bin Laden’s right-hand man and courier. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The number Afridi obtained enabled al Kuwaiti’s voice to be recorded and provided the final confirmation that the tall figure seen by drones in the compound was bin Laden. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I don’t know where he is. I don’t know how he is or how his health is. I am so worried about him,” Afridi’s wife Mona, who lost her job as a teacher, said from a secret location. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Afridi, who was kidnapped in 2008 by Lashkar-e-Islami, an insurgent group allied to the Pakistani Taliban, is believed to have been recruited by the CIA while he was in the US in 2009. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Pakistani officials recovered a GPS device that they said was given to him by US intelligence to arrange rendezvous with his handlers, including on one occasion in the US embassy in Islamabad, the report said. After initial efforts by the US for his release, Afridi is no longer discussed with Islamabad, Pakistani officials said.
